ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to write effectively.
Creative non-fiction writing skills, analyzing others works

EVERYTHING. DUDE. THIS IS THE BEST CLASS EVER. I learned so much about the writing and publishing process and different careers and real-world engagement with the essays we wrote also i hit the max amount of joy possible everytime i entered this classroom I love it so much I have never been happier with a course in my life
This class made me both a better writer and a better reader. The reading list of essays is incredible, and I always gained something from discussing them in class.
This course improved my writing skills massively as well as how to look at writing. I also felt that I discovered my own writers voice which was really cool!
I learned how to write, and how good writers write!
Great creative writing abilities and narrative writing skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths - wide range of writing topics covered
Weaknesses - sometimes a larger focus on reading than writing
I really liked the workshop process. Sometimes a few too many readings and we don't get to them all

Strengths:
- so many fascinating forms of essays to write, most of which can borrow favorited techniques/styles from the others so you can build up your favorite skill set as u go
- Learn to see the world around you in wisps of prose
- learn your strength and worth lowkey

Weaknesses:
- NONE.

Strengths: Kate Bolick is absolutely incredible and the detailed feedback she gives is so helpful! Every class is fun, collaborative, and insightful! The assignments dont feel like assignments due to how much freedom you have to choose what to write about. I wish o could take this class every semester!

Strengths: the readings were always amazing and moving. We read a variety of essays, almost every single one of which I loved. The small classroom setting also allowed us to bond and get to know each other (and our amazing professor, Kate). The open-ended nature of the essays and chance to brain storm helped me work out my creative muscles. The class is fun, dynamic, and really good for beginning writers and experienced ones alike. We had a lot of room to learn and improve individually. 
Weaknesses: I can only take it once!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely! This course has made me such a better writer.
Yes! As a student who is not that into writing, I was nervous about taking this course for a writing credit. I actually really enjoyed it and highly recommend to anyone in the same boat

YES YES YES YES TAKE THIS COURSE IT WILL CHANGE YOUR LIFE PROF BOLICK IS THE BEST PERSON EVER TAKE THIS CLASS TRUST ME. Every time I did homework for this class I literally wanted to scream with joy I would rather legit draft these essays than hangout with friends or go out to parties or talk to my family or literally anything dude this was pure joy and fulfillment constantly and I love it so much TAKE THE CLASS it actually changed my life i am not messing with you take the class

Yes! Especially if you have the chance to take it with Professor Bolick, definitely do. You read some amazing essays and learn a lot. I always looked forward to this class and discussing the readings with my classmates.

YES! Take this class!! It is so much fun, you will laugh every lesson, grow close to your classmates, learn from the ICON Kate Bolick and improve your writing! Its a great class no matter what background you have in writing, and super useful even if you dont want to become a writer. Overall, the best class Ive taken, and Ive taken a lot of good classes.
Absolutely. For writers and non-writers alike. Great learning experience. Really helpful writing practice. Even better thinking practice. Take it with Kate Bolick if you can.

You must take English 120, no matter your writing experience! The readings and class dynamic will help you love to read and write, something I struggled with coming to Yale. You will better understand what good writers do, which is a vital skill.
Yes, I believe this course facilitates great learning of writing skills.
